description: Linear algebra: vectors, matrices, systems of linear equations, eigenvalues and eigenvectors. Vector calculus: functions of several variables, vector fields, line and surface integrals, Green's, Stokes' and divergence theorems. Series solutions of ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms and systems of ordinary differential equations. Use of symbolic manipulation and graphics software.
name: CALCULUS III

values.comments:
Calculus III (MATH 240) is a higher-level Mathematics course that covers a variety of topics including linear algebra, vector calculus, series solutions of ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms and systems of ordinary differential equations. This course also incorporates the use of symbolic manipulation and graphics software. The required text is ‘Advanced Engineering Mathematics’ by Zill Cullen.

Students were very pleased with the quality of the MATH 240 course, claiming that they learned a lot from its contents. A significant amount of work was required but the readings were considered very valuable.

Professor Peter Storm’s communication skills were well received. The students found his lectures to be “precise” and his explanations “made complex and difficult material seem simple and easy”. Professor Storm stimulated the students’ interest by encouraging much class participation and being “personable” and “funny”. Many even regarded him as the “best Math teacher at Penn” because of his accessibility and enthusiasm about his work. Indeed, his teaching style was believed to “enable a 10-year old to understand this class”.

Although the course was challenging and required a significant amount of work, it was still highly recommended for majors and non-majors alike. The pre-requisite is Calculus II (Math 114) and MATH 240 is a requirement for the Mathematics major.
